div.bibl: Onze Toekomst, Mar. 3, 1911. THE NEW DUTCH CIVIC LEAGUE

body.p: p. 1.- Last Monday evening, a meeting took place in the Church of the Second Reformed Congregation of Englewood, in order to definitely organize a division for the 32nd Ward, of the Dutch Civic League. The meeting was well attended. As temporary officers, the following were chosen: J. Van Kampen, President; L. Rietdyk, Secretary and Mr. Vos, Treasurer.

Next Tuesday, another meeting is scheduled, at which meeting the temporary admisistration will make a report, and steps will be taken towards an active participation in the coming elections in April. This meeting will be held for the 31st Ward in the First Reformed Church at 62nd and Peoria Streets and for the 22nd Ward in the Second Reformed Church at 66th and Sangamon Streets.
